main event: An Eastern Airlines DC-3 pilots reported sighting an unidentified flying object, described as a cigar-shaped craft with a blue glow and red-orange flame, 20 miles south of Montgomery, Alabama on July 24, 1948.
interesting points: The pilots saw the object at 2:45 AM while flying at 5,000 feet, with the object appearing 700 feet ahead and slightly above the plane., It was estimated to be about 100 feet long and twice the diameter of a B-29., The object was wingless and had no protruding surfaces but had a snout resembling a radar pole., Witnesses claimed the craft emitted a bright blue glow and left a trailing red-orange flame., The sighting lasted approximately 10-15 seconds before the object pulled up sharply into the clouds.
sighted object: Cigar-shaped aircraft with blue glow and red-orange flame
location: 20 miles south of Montgomery, Alabama, USA
witness description: Eastern Airlines pilots Captain Clarence S. Chiles and Co-pilot John B. Whitted
